subject: Leadership
title: Cross-Cultural Communication
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cross-Cultural Communication.

hook.text: An American asks a Japanese colleague for feedback. She says 'It's interesting.' He hears approval. She meant concern.

buildup.text: Culture shapes how people give feedback, express disagreement, and read silence. Polite in one culture offends another.

discovery.text: Meyer's Culture Map: cultures range from low-context (direct) to high-context (indirect). Knowing where helps greatly.

twist.text: Assuming your style is universal is the most common leadership mistake in global teams. Awareness is step one.

climax.text: Ask: 'How does your team prefer to give feedback?' Adapt your style. Cultural intelligence is a leadership superpower.

punchline.text: Communication is universal. How we communicate is anything but.

quiz.question: What does Erin Meyer's Culture Map describe?
options: How cultures range from direct to indirect communication
